fr.upmc.components.ports

Class AbstractInboundPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.upmc.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentImplementedI, OfferedI, InboundPortI, PortI, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDataInboundPort, AbstractDataOutboundPort, AbstractTwoWayPort, ArrayBlockingQueueConnectionInboundPort, ArrayBlockingQueuePutInboundPort, ArrayBlockingQueueTakeInboundPort, CountDownLatchConnectionInboundPort, CountDownLatchInboundPort, CyclicBarrierConnectionInboundPort, CyclicBarrierInboundPort, DynamicallyConnectableComponentInboundPort, DynamicComponentCreationInboundPort, DynamicConnectionRequestInboundPort, RNGTriggerInboundPort, SemaphoreConnectionInboundPort, SemaphoreInboundPort, SynchronizerManagerInboundPort, URIProviderInboundPort

    public abstract class AbstractInboundPort
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements InboundPortI
    The class AbstractInboundPort partially implements an inbound port which implements the offered interface of the provider component so that the provider can be called through this port.

    Description

    A concrete port class must implement the offered interface of the component with methods that call the corresponding implementation services of their owner component, paying attention to the discipline (synchronised, ...) with which these calls must be made for the given implementation of the component.

    Invariant

     invariant      OfferedI.class.isAssignableFrom(this.implementedInterface)

    Created on : 2011-11-07

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
